Name: King Arthur's Vortex Chess
Description:
Fast tactical game, Chess like, set in Arthurian's mythology universe.

You will be commanding minions as you’ll be casting powerful spells to achieve victory. Special dice will help to control changing board every turn and power hexes give you cards for conducting key maneuvers.

Goal of the game is to defeat opponent mage: Merlin or Mordred.

Every turn you will draw a number of cards depends on how many power hexes your minions are controlling on the board.

Cards in your hand are your actions. Spending them you can move your minions, you can boost attack skill or defenses and at last you can cast special spells, like: tornado, run or stone.

Every player at the beginning of their turn is forced to roll a special die which change an element on the board, making it different each turn. It is the player's choice when the turn ends whether or not he/she has any cards left on a hand or not.

In a tournament version you can use a Chess Clock for a fast and full of emotion game.

Name: Criss Cross
Description:
Scrabble clone that can be dated to about 1950, before the first official Swedish edition of Scrabble. As in Scrabble, gameplay consists of taking turns to place letter tiles forming words on the board to score points, then refilling your hand of tiles. Once there are no more tiles in the stock, the first player to empty their hand ends the game and earns a bonus. Some specifics:


     The board is 17x17 and there are 101 letter tiles.
     Each player has a hand of 8 tiles.
     "Hooking" is allowed.
     If the rules are taken literally, a player may only exchange tiles if they cannot play at all, and must then exchance all of their tiles.
     Base scoring is 5p per vowel and 10p per consonant. White squares score triple, while numbered squares provide a flat but often substantial bonus. It also says you score double for playing in the coloured quadrant corresponding to your tile holder, but the tile holders provided are not coloured.


—user summary

Name: Core Space: Shootout at Zed's
Description:
Shootout at Zed’s is an expansion for Core Space that introduces the dastardly Zed and his gang of criminals, a new type of NPC, as well as some new Civilians. Learn to love or loathe them in a series of thrilling new missions, and then add them to your regular games with the new Event Cards. They are also a fully playable Trader crew!

New terrain adds the centrepiece two-storey Zed’s Bar to your board, and new equipment such as the Teleport Grenade will give your crew new ways to survive!

—description from the publisher

Name: Twilight Express
Description:
The Twilight Express is a transcontinental train that carries all sorts of goods, crossing every city on the continent.
Every day at twilight, the train, loaded with expensive goods, departs from the main station, fuming out smoke. Heavily guarded, the Twilight Express is no easy target for robbers and bandits.

However, some people just never let go. And the players will have to make plans, hiring mercenaries and storing coal for their vehicles, to try to rob more expensive items from the train than the others. But when it comes to fighting the guards, they have to unite and thus, share the loot. And sometimes, plans just don’t work as planned and they could miss the train. No worries however as the Twilight Express will leave the station tomorrow and the next day as well!

The winner of the game is the one who, with a clever strategy, robs the most money from the train!

Each player secretly chooses cities where their bandits and coals should be sent. When all plans have been made, the players simultaneously reveal their plans and then send their bandits and coals to the chosen cities. Actions will be carried out only in the cities where player's bandits or coals have been placed in a row from the main station in City # 1.

Depending on the cities chosen by the players, they can rob cargo by repelling security guards, sell collected cargo, or even steal large amounts of gold at the gold mine.

The game ends when all the cargo tiles run out. The player with the highest score after adding the points gained with gold, and the special cards, wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Rugby: The Game
Description:
Rugby The Game is all about putting you right in the middle of the action. The playing board is clear and simple to use, keeping a focus on the action, front-and-centre.

The board is split with teams facing each other. There are six slots on the board for active players, a field ruler to indicate the position of the ball on the field, and slots for  Player decks and General Play Cards.

The middle of the game board visualises the action happening around the ball. Sure there are 15 players on each team, but only a handful are in action at any time.

Each phase of play involves each team taking one action, such as running, bringing in support players, tackling, kicking, etc, and then resolving the outcome. For example, if the attacking team chooses to run (action), they simply move the field marker on the ruler. Play then goes to the defending team who can try and tackle (action), a successful tackle goes to a Ruck, and an unsuccessful tackle means play returns to the attacker.

—description from the designer

Name: Zapanhak
Description:
Zapanhak is a simple solitaire survival game that can be played using regular playing cards and a few tokens or coins. This game mimics a classic CCG duel but pares it back to its most basic elements. You play as a sorcerer fighting for your life against a horde of deadly creatures, casting spells and summoning creatures of your own.

Creatures are made up of two cards: one for attack and one for defence. You bring your ally creatures to life by choosing which of the cards in your hand will be used for their attack and defence. Each of your creatures will be given a turn each round, which they use by attacking or blocking an enemy creature.

You and your virtual opponent take turns sending creatures into the arena, with enemies in one row and allies in another row underneath. The goal of your enemies is to kill you and anything that gets in their way. Your allies benefit from your spells and can combine some attacks and defences, as well as save certain turns for later use. But your enemies are relentless and have a greater range of attack and defence.

To win, you must play through the deck and defeat the entire horde of attacking enemies before your life is reduced to zero. You lose if you fail to achieve this objective for any reason.

-description from designer

Name: Das große Elbespiel: Vom Michel zur Kugelbake
Description:
The players have to get their pawn (steamship) from space 1 (Michel) to space 16 (Kugelbake) and back to space 30 (Michel). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the player. The first to reach space 30 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Battle Cubes: The Age of Aries
Description:
Lead your clan to victory in this fast-paced strategy game. Only one clan is destined to rule the Pangea. Win the game by making smart and strategic moves with your clan army in order to capture opponents' battle and chieftain cubes. Use traps and obstacles to your advantage, but beware of traitors in your ranks which could off balance your supremacy on the board. Become the only ruler of Pangea and force other clans to worship you as the supreme leader of Pangea.

Battle Cubes, the Age of Aries uses several different game mechanics, including dice rolling, worker placement, action selection, battle, and area control. Each clan has different special abilities which makes them unique. The game's length is determined by the number of battle cubes that players select to start the game with.

The unique thing about the game is the battle cube surrender action which shifts the balance of powers on the board. There is also direct player interaction in which players play their defensive actions on opponents' clan boards.

—description from the designer

Name: Rinn in Pott!
Description:
To start the game, each player puts a token into his pott, places the pot on any space on the game board and puts his remaining tokens on the space of his color.

Movement of the potts is determined by a die. The potts may move in any direction. If a pott gets on a space occupied by another pott, the later has to spill all it's tokens into the arriving pott. The player of th now empty pott has to put a new token from his colored space on the board into the pot.

If a player has no tokens remaining, he is eliminated from the game. The last remaining player wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Fat Cat
Description:
Push your luck to see who can be friends with the fattest cats.

On your turn, put a gift card into a row (bribes). If there are three matching suits in a row, that cat is busted: remove that row from this round. It would be easy, but at least one card is face down in the row at set up, so the row might be busted without you knowing it.

Grab a row before they're all gone, but only the highest sum at the end of each round keeps their fat cat card (and the victory points they are worth).

Each round has variable fat cats that keep things fresh. To win, collect 800 victory points or three fat cats. But each fat cat you befriend adds a suit to your future rounds, adding headwind to early leaders.

—description from the publisher

Name: Apocalypse au Zoo de Carson City: Les Extensions de Linda
Description: Apocalypse au Zoo de Carson City: Les Extensions de Linda, an expansion for Apocalypse au Zoo de Carson City, allows for gameplay with up to six players, while also including an adventure mode for both solitaire and multiplayer experience and a "Linda mode" for expert players. Curious...

Name: Colossal Cave: The Board Game – ADV550 Expansion
Description:
You've braved the hazards of Colossal Cave and achieved the exalted rank of Adventurer Grandmaster. But more fabulous treasures await you in the adventure 550 expansion! Will you be the first to travel to the far side of the Volcano View, map the Ice Caverns, and defeat the Nasty-Looking Ogre?

This expansion for Colossal Cave: The Board Game adds new puzzles, treasures and locations to the base game.

Name: Världen runt
Description:
Världen runt ("Around the world") is a simple roll-and-move game themed as a trip around the world by boat, train and plane. There are event spaces where you lose turns, take alternate routes and such, but no player decisions.

There is very little information attached. The inclusion on the cover of what appears to be a converted B-24 Liberator may date the game to the late 1940s; illustrator ollejoh is known to have provided art for another game dated to 1948. The bottom of the box is stamped with "X29", but the significance of this is unknown.

—user summary

Name: NUTSO
Description:
NUTSO is the most outrageous card game you will ever play. A poker-styled card game designed for the entire family. It's like Texas Hold'em with a twist. Your hand is only as good as the last player's move. Let's just say if you think you have the best hand, you're probably wrong.

Combine your two cards with the five community cards to make the best five card hand. Be the only player left by collecting all the NUTSO bucks.

Each player receives a starting stack of NUTSO bucks totaling $15,000. Determine who will deal the first hand by dealing one card at a time to each player. First player dealt a NUTSO card deals first. The deal then alternates clockwise for the rest of the game unless someone plays the Pass The Button wild card and takes the deal. Helpful card: You can use the dealer card in the deck to keep track of who is dealing.

Before each hand is dealt, all players, except the dealer place $500 NUTSO bucks in the middle. The dealer then gives 2 card to each player and deals 5 cards face down in the middle, these are the community cards. After reviewing the 2 cards in their hands players can either stay in the game by placing the same amount of NUTSO bucks that started the hand or quit the hand. The decision to bet or fold starts with the player left to the dealer. After betting is over the dealer turns over the first 3 of the community card for another round of betting or folding. Each player is trying to build the winning hand using a combination of the 2 player cards and the 5 community cards. Dealer than turns over the fourth card for another round of betting and folding. Final community card is turned over for a final round of betting and folding. The showdown begins when all remaining players will expose their hands and the best hand wins all the NUTSO bucks in the middle. Winning hands look a lot like poker hands.

The real beauty of NUTSO are the wild cards. When played they can take down the strongest hand or turn a losing hand into a winner. Then again if you play one it might ruin your chances of winning. Who knows? That's why this game is called NUTSO.

—description from the publisher

Name: Anthelion: Conclave of Power – The Cultists: Faction Pack
Description:
Cultists worship night and day, completely changing their behavior depending on the time. You can always ask them for help, but check the clock first.

The Cultists: Faction Pack introduces the Cultists faction into Anthelion: Conclave of Power.


Released in the June 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Dragon Ball Z
Description:
Remove the packaging from the cards. Place the cards in the holder with the question side facing forward. Choose a player to go first. Play then continues clockwise. 
Roll the die to decide a category color.
Another player takes the front card and reads you the question from that category.
If you answer correctly the card goes to the back of the deck. Roll the die again to go for a "Wedge" question.
This time if you answer the question correctly keep the card in front of you.
To win another card you must correctly answer a question on a new card, then correctly answer a "Wedge" question on the next card.
Keep going until you get an answer wrong. This ends your turn.

The first player to collect six cards wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fire in the Library: The Card Game
Description:
Fire in the Library: The Card Game is a press-your-luck game in which players must try their best to rescue books and accumulate knowledge, much like in the original Fire in the Library game. However, instead of pulling tokens from a bag, players are drawing cards from a deck and organizing volumes of books, hopefully into stacks that don't overlap language or edition so the most total knowledge is saved.

Players are clever librarians, so of course they have tools at their disposal to help save even more books and to allow players to push their luck to the next level.

Take your chances, be the bravest, and save books in Fire in the Library: The Card Game!

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games

Name: Adventures in Valyriah: Chapter One – The Great Forest
Description:
Adventures in Valyriah - The Great Forest is an out and back treasure hunt type game. The players set out from the village of Raventown blazing a path into the Great Forest, each searching for 2 items. The first player to successfully bring their 2 items back to Raventown wins. While this might seem a bit boring, there are many things lurking about in the forest that might put some excitement in your travels and thwart your progress.

The game is designed as a family game, with no significant strategic advantages for anyone. As a matter of fact, trying to play strategically might just prove futile. Just when you think you are in a position to win, events may well mess things up. The game is designed for competition, but can also have some cooperative elements if the players should so choose. For videos and more information, please see links below. Thank you for your interest!

—description from the designer

Name: Wild One
Description:
Before 1860, the West was simply known as the West, but then the Wild family arrived and changed EVERYTHING. Their impact was immediate and far-reaching. The West was no longer the West, it was the WILD WEST!

Now, the year is 1885. The Wild family has made a fortune through various “marketing” strategies, “business” ventures, and “community” projects. More importantly, the Wild family has emblazoned their name on both a territory and an era. After decades of pure wildness, the Wilds are tuckered out and ready for retirement. The family has grown tired of being ridiculously, filthy, stinking rich and they’ve done everything there is to do in the West.

After a raucous family council, the Wilds have decided to give away half of their fortune and head east to retire as New York City slickers. The family wants someone with basic mathematical skills who is also able to wisely manage money without going into debt. Most importantly, though, the Wilds want someone to carry on their Wild legacy in the West; a person with rambunctious spunkiness and tons of true grit.

The family has designed a simple competition to determine who will win the Wild Family Fortune and the glorious title of WILD ONE. Challengers have come from near and far to participate in this unprecedented event. As a challenger, your task is to manage basic income and expenses and stay as close to “1” as possible without going broke or into debt. Of course, there are other challengers attempting to do the exact same thing. Besides being known for their immense wealth, the Wild family also has a reputation for being very “hands-on.” During the contest, they will get down and dirty to help their favorite challenger win. Will you emerge victorious and be named the Wild One?

Name: Scharz
Description:
This game consists of three separately saleable parts that can be combined to form a Scharz game (for 12 players):
Part I: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/344934/scharz-part-i
Part II: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/344935/scharz-part-ii
Part III: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/344939/scharz-part-iii
and a separately playable expansion (compatible with the original game) - Battle: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/401728/para-bellum-proelii

In this area control game, the player must master the management of their own empire, its development and conflict with other players. Time in each year, resources and human capacity are limited. Expanding the economic base, building more footholds, improving them, buying better livestock and soldiers, developing trade and fleets - all this is possible and beneficial, but it also requires expensive military protection. Because even those who feed their large army on the snowball principle from the resources of others can win.

Game time 15 - 40 minutes per player, recommended for ages 10 and up.

The original game, referred to as Complete, contains three separately sold parts, labeled Part I, Part II and Part III. Each part contains 2 unique maps and 4 unique player sets and 4 modes (Fast, Basic, Original, Extended). You can play one of four modes on one of six maps in 2-12 players.

—description from the designer

Name: Bellum Sacrum
Description:
The gods of Mount Olympus - Mars, Minerva, Neptune, Bellona et al - pass the time honing their skills on the battle field.

Bellum Sacrum is a two player competitive card game. Each player plays with an identical deck of 42 cards. There are 10 different card types in a deck, each identified with a number, a colour and the name of a Roman god. There are 3 copies of the most powerful card and 6 copies of the weakest card, with a sliding scale in-between.

Each card has an attack and defence rating as well as a unique invocation power.

Each player has an imaginary column into which they deploy warriors. The column has three positions - front, middle and back. In general, warriors at the front of the column attack warriors at the front of their opponents column. Other warriors can support an attack.

The goal of the game is to collect five trophies. Trophies are won by removing all of the warriors in your opponent's column. Warriors are removed from a column through a strategic mix of attacks and invocations.

Players take turns, with each turn consisting of four actions. The player may chose from a list of five possible actions, which can be played in any number and order up to a total of four. The actions are as follows:

1) Draw: The player draws three cards from their deck.
2) Deploy: The player places a warrior into their battle column. The warrior may be a single card or multiple cards of the same type. Warriors made of multiple cards are stronger.
3) Attack: A ready warrior at the front of your column attacks the warrior at the front of your opponent's column.
4) Strengthen: Cards of the same type can be added to a warrior.
5) Invoke: Place a card from your hand into the discard pile to activate the invocation power on a card. Invocations can be blocked by an opponent discarding the same card.

-description from designer

Name: Bizarre Bid
Description:
"I auction a kidney for 40,000 Bidcoins." Is a phrase that can begin to sound normal after you smack with organs.

Bizarre Bid is an auction game in which each player embodies a boss of a mafia, whose goal is to amass a huge fortune with organ trafficking in the black market. To do this, they have the support of a morgue who owes a lot of money to the mafia and settle their accounts with... Donations?

Get the respect of your mafia being the best seller, buy and, above all, auction with organs.

—description from the publisher

Name: 仲木戸⇔新逗子への旅 (Nakakido Shinzushi heno Tabi)
Description:
ä»²æœ¨æˆ¸⇔æ–°é€—å­ã¸ã®æ—… (Nakakido Shinzushi heno Tabi) is a Japanese train game, designed quickly to celebrate the 3rd anniversary of Gamifi (a group that helps promote JPgames).

The designer wanted to capture the names of two railway stations, Nakakido and Shinzushi, on the private Keikyu line, before they are renamed in March 2020.

In the game, players try and build their own train journeys using the different decks of cards and dice to make a route on the Keikyu network. The four types of cards allow the different train speeds (normal, express, limited express, express special).

The game was made in a simple draw bag, and includes a blank d6 for a special undisclosed function.
user summary

Name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Rynn's World Air War Campaign Book
Description:
When Waaagh! Snagrod descended upon Rynn’s World, it heralded a conflict so devastating that it led to the near destruction of the Crimson Fists Chapter. The Rynn’s World Air War Campaign book enables you to refight the brutal aerial battles fought over the course of the war between the Imperial Navy and the Ork Flyboyz.

This 88-page hardback campaign book includes the following information (and more!):

- The full Aeronautica Imperialis game rules, including how to build your force using Squadron Lists, how to perform Ace Manoeuvres, field different classes of aircraft and unleash ground defences. Learn how to manoeuvre your aircraft, adjust their altitude and change speed while avoiding the risks of crashing and breaking up (if you exceed your maximum speed). There are even rules for special manoeuvres including landing, taxiing, and taking-off.
- In an-depth background on the infamous war that took place when Waaagh! Snagrod fell upon Rynn's World, the homeworld of the Crimson Fists Space Marines Chapter.
- Six narrative scenarios set, each with descriptions of how these relate to the War for Rynn's World and optional special rules that can be used to accurately reflect that war.
- Rules for campaign play, including how to replace destroyed aircraft, and level up your pilots as they gain experience.
- Squadron Lists, providing details of the following aircraft, including their weapon options and special rules: Thunderbolt Fighter, Thunderbolt Fury Fighter, Marauder Bomber, Marauder Destroyer, Dakkajet, Fighta Bommer, Eavy Bommer, and Grot Bommer.
- Rules for ground assets such as the Hydra Flak Battery, Manticore Missile Battery, Flak Platform, and 'Eavy Flak Kannon.
- Rules for the following legendary ace pilots: Flight Commander Dagor-Jarni, Flight Lieutenant Gale Barret, Da Black Baron, and Sky Boss Toofkraker – each including a profile of their aircraft and special rules.
- Example colour schemes of Imperial Navy and Ork aircraft.
- A reference page showing the 8 different manoeuvres aircraft can take, as well as a 2-page quick reference containing the key game rules.

Name: Rurik: Dawn of Kiev – Intrigue Cards 1
Description:
An 11 card mini-expansion included as part of the Kickstarter edition of Rurik: Dawn of Kiev.

In between the 4 rounds, a new intrigue card is activated with an effect that requires players to adjust their strategy. Only one intrigue card is active at a time. Intrigue cards typically impact the Planning phase (e.g. requiring players to pay coins when placing advisors in some situations) but some intrigue cards impact other parts of the game (e.g. mustering a troop anywhere on the board).

—description from the publisher

Name: Mapominoes: Eurail Interrail
Description:
It's like dominoes but with maps, as you build a map of the Eurail network, by connecting countries that share a common border. Stay one step ahead of your opponents, as you race to be the first player to play all your country cards on the table and win the game.

This game is not for sale, but has been sent as a gift to travelers who have purchased a Eurail or Interrail pass.

—description from the box

Name: Talleyrand
Description:
"The art of statesmanship is to foresee the inevitable and to expedite its occurrence." ~ Talleyrand

Talleyrand is a cutthroat trick-taking game for 3-5 players set during the political turmoil of the French Revolution. Players use multi-suited cards to win tricks, but winning too much too quickly can make one vulnerable to being purged when the regime changes. Players must anticipate purges to retain influence (won cards) and end on top. Each round takes about 15 minutes, with multiple rounds for optional extended play.

Based around the political turmoil of the French Revolution, Talleyrand is named after Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord, an incorrigible gambler and political schemer who managed to ride out the manifold purges and executions of the revolution, while maintaining multiple positions in many of the successive governments and lining his pockets. Always able to escape with his head and reputation (mostly) intact just prior to everything falling apart, Talleyrand held key roles during the reign of Louis XVI and the Revolutionary Government; he was at Napoleon's side when he toppled the Directorate and later when he declared himself Emperor, and even managed to survive Napoleon's downfall thereafter with a career intact in the restoration of the Monarchy — twice. Talleyrand was, above all, a survivor, and this game celebrates that trait.
 —description from designer

Name: MindMaze: Jeunes Detectives
Description:
In Mind Maze players will be told a story and must figure out why and how the story happened by asking questions that can be answered with "Yes" or "No". The person telling the story can also choose to answer with “Not Important” if players start getting too far off track.

Mind Maze allows players to test their skills of deduction and investigation, and to get to the bottom of the mystery with as few questions as possible. Players take turns asking questions, and lose a point for every question they ask. Points can be gained by asking specific key questions which also help players to figure out the true version of the story. This encourages players to think carefully about the questions they ask and to work together.

In MindMaze: Jeunes Detectives ("Young Detectives"), the cards are aimed at a younger audience than the other games of the series. 
The questions are easier to answer, and also much more "family friendly".

Name: Aeon's End: The New Age – Promo Pack
Description:
46 Card Promo Pack from Aeon's End: The New Age that includes promo cards P18-P23 and P050-P089.

Treasured Spell

     Sparrow's Aid
     Nym's Vision


Treasured Gem

     Reeve's Raven Shard


Treasure Level 2

     Wraith's Essence


Treasure Level 3

     Endless Bandolier
     Volatile Clasp
     Fanged Choker
     Breach Stabilizer


Gem

     Fractured Quartz x 7 + Randomizer


Relic

     Rock Launcher x 5 + Randomizer
     Abacus of Ignition x 5 + Randomizer


Spell

     Illuminating Flame x 5 + Randomizer
     Chronal Arc x 5 + Randomizer
     Thieving Spirit x 5 + Randomizer

Name: Ancients Part 1 (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
This fan scenario (AT) will take you to a magical world (inspired by Asia) where you will encounter a new faction connected to the Syaan and Elois in a mysterious way. The scenario serves as an introduction to the trilogy and is a bit a tribute to the old RPGs and role-playing gamebooks - so you will need to have your dice ready!

The trilogy is set in several times and timelines (AT and NT) and will take you on a greater journey where not only the background to Elois, Syaan and the third faction will be revealed eventually but also the question of your allegiance will be raised.

—description from the designer

Name: ジュンゴ (Jungo)
Description:
ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ³ã‚´ (Jungo) is a two player Japanese abstract game. Twin princesses compete using the exotic animals in the castle courtyard. The winner gets to choose which cake to eat first.

Players bring numbered tokens onto the 5x5 square grid, in number order. The game combines the pinching rules from Othello, the area rules from Go and the attacking rules of Shogi, into a new game. Players capture their opponents pieces which they can then use later on. But pieces must be used in numerical order; 1,2,3,4,5 then 1,2...
user summary

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Reject Pack 3
Description: A limited release expansion for Cards Against Humanity, only available at a convention in 2019.

Name: Nothing Personal: Scenes of the Crime
Description:
Scenes of the Crime introduces location cards to Nothing Personal which allows your family to exert their influence on some of the city's most infamous places.

Includes 5 oversized location cards and 1 rule card.

Location cards are compatible with both the Revised Edition and the original version of Nothing Personal.

Name: Mardi Gras Madness
Description:
Mardi Gras Madness offers the fun and frenzy of a Mardi Gras parade all year long! Compete for a wide range of throws and earn points for what you catch, how much you catch, and for matching sets of throws. The strategy lies in beating the crowd to the throws you want. But watch out! Another player can toss a well-timed “Throw Me Something” card to change the parade and put your best laid plans in jeopardy. Of course, you have “Throw Me Something” cards, too…. Are you ready for some Mardi Gras Madness?

Winning Mardi Gras Madness means catching the best combination of throws to score the most points at the end of your parade. Each “Throws Card” has a value from 0 to 6, and collecting the right sets of matching cards can boost your end game scoring.

When two or more players try to catch the same throws, a roll-off occurs. Highest roll wins all the throws!

"Throw Me Something" cards are specific advantages that allow players to break the rules. You earn them when you lose roll-offs. So no matter what happens, players are always working to improve their standing at the parade.

Mardi Gras Madness has a challenging solo mode, authentic artwork, a family-friendly theme and a fun pace!

-description from publisher

Name: You Think You Know Me
Description:
You know your friends through the photos, videos, and messages they post online, liking and favoriting them every day. But how well do you know them, really?

You Think You Know Me playfully tests how well you know your friends, giving you a chance to learn more about what they love and who they are. Each player starts with seven cards in hand, cards that say things like "I know that your secret talent is ________" or "I know that you would/wouldn't want to live forever." On a turn, you pick another player, play a card from hand, and say how you think they would answer the question. If you're right, you discard the card; if not, you have to draw a new card and add it to your hand. Whoever first discards all their cards wins.

Name: Unstable Unicorns: Disaster Relief Unicorn Promo Card
Description:
Being part of something bigger! 100% of the proceeds of this card were donated to United Way Worldwide in response to Hurricane Florence.

Magical Unicorn Card
Play text:
"When this card enters your Stable, each player must SACRIFICE all Downgrade cards.  Search the deck for an Upgrade card and bring it directly into your Stable.  Shuffle the deck."

Name: SQULA Familiebordspel
Description:
Educational kids quiz game.

Roll the dice, answer quiz questions about all the classes in school and try to earn the most points.
Every player gets questions that match his/her level. The player with the most points wins. This makes learning fun!
Do you know better than your parents at table. The tension stays til the last minute.
—description from the box (translated)

Name: Godsland
Description:
Godsland – A board game which unites 5 mythologies: Greek, Egyptian, Norse, Chinese and Georgian. Choose your favorite mythology and lead your nation to victory. Use mythical creatures and other warriors to conquer lands and become the only ruler of this world. Bring glory to your nation by wise and proper strategy plans. NO LUCK! Everything is in your hands! Nothing limits your decisions. The only limit is your enemy. You will feel the real taste of strategy game when you rule the country based on your skills and not luck. 3D miniature figures, different boards, effective system for controlling resources, tokens, different cards. all this in one game – Godsland!

During the game you will have to make decisions as you have different options: taking resources, recruiting soldiers, attacking neighbor territories, selling different resources to get more gold, upgrading villages, breaking and building bridges, using god’s powers, mythical creatures
It is crucial to have a good strategy in this game as everything depends on you. To become the mighty ruler you will have to control at least 15 territories.

Beside your warriors you will have to use mythical creatures to defeat your enemies. During the game you will get some cards where can be blessing or fury from your gods. Those might help you for achieving your goals or on the opposite benefit your enemies.

—description from the designer

Name: レッツ・プレイ・イノベーション！！ (Let's Play Innovation!!)
Description:
ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒ„ãƒ»ãƒ—ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ»ã‚¤ãƒŽãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ï¼ï¼ (Let's Play Innovation!!) is a Japanese card game developed by a company specialising in business training. The core idea of the game is that players must go through a number of business failures before reaching success. That is, you cannot win the game without first failing. The process is intended to teach resilience, innovation, and the benefits of trial and error.

During the game, the players operate a business and aim for success. The game has a deck of cards, each providing different events, some progress their goals, some set them back, some provide new opportunities. Players try to develop their enterprise and turn setbacks into innovations, with a take that element in gameplay.

Players draw to their hand and then play from their hand. Some cards have special enhancing effects to already played cards. Most of the cards are split diagonally, with a positive side, and a black negative side. When a player puts the card into their tableau, they can turn it to show the positive benefits, or turn it to show the negative failures. Players must build on their failures before they can win.
user summary

Name: Rocket Drop
Description:
This marble drop game contains small plastic balls rather than real marbles.

Each player removes a stick and tries not to let any of the balls drop.  The player with the least balls at the end of the game wins.

Name: Buffet Master
Description:
In Buffet Master players strive to fill their stomachs from the offerings at the buffet before the buffet runs out of food, but also to not overindulge or waste food.

Each turn the players each take at least one but up to 6 menu items (cards) from the Buffet's offerings randomly displayed in six trays (the face up top cards of six decks).  The menu items combine into various meals of 1 to 4 items each and are arranged in specific shapes.  Menu items are worth 0 to 4 points each, with those forming larger meals generally worth more points.  Completed meals are eaten by removing them from the hand and placimg them in the player's eaten deck.

Various special cards allow players to swoop in to grab food during another player's turn, return food in hand to the trays, take food out of another player's hand, and other effects.

The game ends when any one of the trays has been emptied of menu items.  Players then see if they have filled their stomachs, overeaten, or wasted food.  Eaten meals are arranged in a grid (size depends on number of players): if the grid is completely filled with no gaps or excess, they have successfully filled their stomachs and gain a bonus.  Eaten meals that don't fit in the stomach score a penalty; uneaten food still in hand scores a greater penalty.  Highest score wins.

Name: MatriO
Description:
MatriO is a card and board game based on matrix multiplication. The game is played with standard (usually miniature-sized) playing cards and a special board, using specially designed markers to maintain player scores.

The board is laid out with three grids, a 3x4 grid and a 4x3 grid of card-sized trays and a 3x3 grid where players' "dot markers" are placed during the game. One of the card-tray grids is positioned to the left of the 3x3 grid, and the other card-tray grid is positioned above the 3x3 grid. The trays are labeled by card suit, a total of six trays for each suit.

Players are each dealt 13 cards (jokers are left in the deck, and the 4 of clubs and 10 of diamonds are discarded in advance of dealing). Players take turns placing a card in one of the trays on the board. If there are empty trays labeled with a given suit, then cards of that suit may only be played in one of those empty trays, and suited cards may not be played in an empty tray labeled with a different suit. Jokers may be played anywhere at any time.

When a player completes a row-column combination by filling the last empty tray of a row or column, the player places one of their "dot makers" in the cell of the 3x3 grid corresponding to the row and column combination they have just completed. The sum of the products of the correspondingly positioned cards in the row and column become that makers "dot score". This score can change throughout the game as other cards are laid in trays in that row and column.

When all 9 cells in the 3x3 grid are filled by players' dot markers, any player with no dot markers on the board is out of the game and their cards are discarded.

Remaining players continue to place their cards. When those players have plaid all their cards, the winner of the game is the player whose dot scores total is highest.

Numerical scores of cards are as follows: Queen of Spades: 13, all other black face cards 10, all black number cards their own numerical value. All red face cards are -10, and all red number cards are negative their own value. Jokers are 0.

—description from the designer

Name: Frostgrave: Perilous Dark
Description:
There are many tales of the Frozen City, and not all of them tell of battles between rival wizards. Often, the greatest adventures are those that pit a wizard and his trusty warband against the myriad perils found amidst the ruins of Felstad.

This new supplement for Frostgrave presents full rules for playing solo and co-operative games in which feuds and skirmishes of wizards take a back seat to the exploration and unlocking of the mysteries of the city. These include guidelines for both dungeon crawls and adventuring in the ruins, new traps, unique random encounters, and four multi-scenario mini-campaigns to get players started.

Why should wizards fight amongst themselves? There is plenty of treasure for all and the Frozen City is enemy enough!

Name: Sick Pirate Mutiny
Description:
"Sick Pirate Mutiny" is a social-deduction type party card game issued by Luddum Studio. It has got a UNIQUE game play you've never heard before: combining "Memory", "Guessing Ability" and "Physical Activities" together, thus making BOTH your BRAIN & BODY Sweat during the game!

Players are divided into 2 teams, and the goal is to correctly guess every opponents’ Pirate Card. The team that first finishes this goal wins the game.

Why This Game is FUN And UNIQUE?

     You must use both your BRAIN (memory & guessing ability) and BODY (physical endurance)
     it’s quite a CRAZY CHALLENGE!
     You & your friends will drink a lot (you can agree on WATER or ALCOHOL, it’s up to you), but are not allowed to go to the restroom!
     Eliminated players can still actively participate in the game.


—description from the publisher

Name: Fight of the Worlds (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
Unofficial scenario.

Year 5561, Alternative Time. You are faced with yet another anomaly that has changed usual way of life to the Consortium. Instructions for your mission are standard: to find and eliminate anomaly, to vanish consequences. But all will be not so simple at this time.

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – TIE Reaper Expansion Pack
Description:
Designed to deliver specialized soldiers, such as Director Krennic's death troopers, into the raging heart of battle, the TIE reaper is the Empire's premier high-performance transport. Equipped with advanced ailerons for precise atmospheric maneuvering, thick armor plating, powerful laser cannons, and the capacity to carry elite infantry, this menacing vessel struck fear into Rebel forces across the galaxy.

Within the TIE Reaper Expansion Pack for Star Wars: X-Wing, you'll find a beautifully detailed and pre-painted TIE reaper miniature alongside the second edition versions of four ship cards, ten upgrade cards, and the Optimized Prototype condition card, all identical to the second edition content originally released as part of Wave XIV for the first edition of X-Wing. Finally, this expansion also includes two new Quick Build Cards providing exciting pre-defined combinations for you to begin experimenting with your TIE reaper.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Monster Food Trucks
Description:
Have you ever seen a Monster with a full belly? Neither have we! That´s why in the city of Monstruopolis they won´t stop eating everything they can get their hands on. Since the first appearance of a Food Truck in Monstruopolis, the Chefs in town have decided to hit the road as well and offer their delicacies on the streets. 
If the greatest chefs have left their restaurants and are making good Monsterbucks on the streets, so can you ... Will you rise to the challenge and become the next greatest Monster Chef?

In Monster Food Trucks you will become a monstruous chef dedicated to satisfy the hunger of any creature ready to pay for your amazing dishes.
Each game lasts 5 rounds, divided in 5 phases each, in which you will be buying ingredients, cooking meals and delivering them to your hungry customers in order earn victory points and Monsterbucks.
But not everything is about winning... In this land we are environmentally aware and cooking warm meals, dumping the trash or moving around with your truck will pollute the city and nobody likes that: polution will be taking a lot of victory points off your track at the end of the game if you don´t behave!
The players will earn additional points at the end of the game by having the “Coolest FoodTruck” and by having the most number of completed orders for each kind of color. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game will be the winner.

Will you be the next Monster Chef?

This game features:

     Random client locations and needs setup
     Early information of future events
     Market supply and demand mechanics
     Zone movement and stock management
     Card drafting and Food Truck tuning
     Self balanced player turn order


—description from the publisher

¿Alguna vez habéis visto a un monstruo saciado? ¡Nosotros tampoco! Por eso en Monstruópolis no paran de comer todo lo que está a su alcance. 
Desde la aparición de los Food Trucks, los Chefs de la ciudad han salido a la calle a ofrecer sus extravagantes platos por todo Monstruópolis.
Si los chef más prestigiosos han dejado sus restaurantes y están ganando muchos Monstruopavos en la calle, ¿por qué no hacerlo tú? ¿Estarás a la altura y te convertirás en el Monster Chef más famoso?

En Monster Food Trucks the convertirás en un monstruoso chef con el objetivo de satisfacer el apetito de toda criatura dispuesta a pagar por tus espectaculares recetas.
Cada partida dura 5 rondas, divididas a su vez en 5 fases cada una, en las cuales comprarás ingredientes, cocinarás y venderás tus platos a tus hambrientos clientes para ganar puntos de victoria y Monstruopavos.
Pero no todo es ganar... En Monstruópolis estamos muy concienciados con el medio ambiente y cocinar platos calientes, tirar la basura o moverte con la furgo contamina y eso no nos gusta; ¡esta polución te restará puntos de victoria al final de la partida si no te portas bien!
Al final de la partida, se premiarán la "FoodTruck más molona" y los chefs que hayan completado el mayor número de recetas de cada tipo. 
¡El jugador con más puntos de victoria al final de la partida será el ganador de Monster Food Trucks!
¿Serás tú el próximo Monster Chef?

Este juego presenta las siguientes mecánicas:

     Colocación de los clientes y sus necesidades de manera aleatoria
     Información parcial sobre los turnos futuros
     Mercado de oferta y demanda
     Movimiento por el mapa y gestión de recursos
     Card drafting y tuneo de tu Food Truck
     Orden de turno de los jugadores autoequilibrado


—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts: Confundus! Promo Card
Description:
This promo card was handed out during GenCon 2019.

This Spell carries the following ability:

Opponent discards a card at random. If it was a Hex or Spell, gain 1 [INFLUENCE] and draw a card. If it was an Ally or Item, gain 1 [ATTACK] and 1 [LIFE].

Name: Premier Soccer
Description:
Premier Soccer is a dice-driven simulation of top-flight English football designed for competitive or solitaire play. You are the manager: choosing a tactical formation and style of play, selecting your lineup, making substitutions, and dealing with player discipline, fatigue, and injuries. Every aspect of play is based on actual league, team, and player statistics. All of the top-flight teams and players from the 2017-2018 and 2018-2019 seasons are yours to choose from, so you can re-enact your favorite ties or replay an entire season. A full game can be played comfortably in 30-45 minutes on a small table top.

—description from the designer

Name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts: Felix Felicis Promo Card
Description:
This promo card was handed out during GenCon 2019.

This Item carries the following ability:

Choose odd or even. Then reveal the top card of the Classroom deck. If its value matches your choice, gain 2 [ATTACK]. Otherwise, gain 2 [LIFE].

Name: The Original Ski Game
Description:
Let's go skiing with Alberto Tomba!!!

What's it all about.....

During the game you will play the part of a ski instructor in a large ski resort. The snow is perfect, the slopes are inviting and the facilities for the apres-ski are excellent. In other words the perfect ski surroundings.

Being a ski instructor is a popular profession and your competitors are awaiting their chance. Time and again you must prove your professional skills.

During the game you should try to score points off your collegues from the other skiing schools in speed, strategic insight and technique. Of course, you must not act recklessly as you must try to keep your pupils attentive while at the same time producing some results. What will you do? Will you conquer the black slope with the best pupils from your class or do you vote for team building and aim at getting all your pupils on the slope at the same time? Maybe you want to win the game by putting the other teams in a position where they cannot ski any further? Maybe you will decide on your goal during the game and let the situations you meet on your way guide you. It won't be easy to cross the finish first. On the way competing colleagues and unexpected obstacles may cause extra problems. So keep a cool head.

Have fun and good luck!

—description from the box

Name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts: Dobby the House-Elf Promo Card
Description:
This promo card was handed out during GenCon 2019.

This Ally carries the following ability:

Once per Turn: You may banish a card in the Classroom.

Name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts: Golden Snitch Promo Card
Description:
This promo card was handed out during GenCon 2019.

This Item carries the following ability:

If you have 2 or more Allies in play, gain 3 [INFLUENCE] and draw 2 cards. If not, gain 1 [ATTACK] and 1 [LIFE].

Name: Fletter
Description:
What you have in your hands is an exciting, challenging, adrenalin-pumping word game.

The way to play it, is to shout out words from letters placed before you, before the other players can. There is no timer. But, you gotta think fast and act faster than your opponents to claim your words. The words you claim give you points.

The game is played in 4 rounds, starting from 3-letter words to 6-letter words. At the end of the last round, the player with the most points is the winner. But, know this, if you wanna win, you must be prepared to lose your voice. Go on then, give it a shout!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Ganz Schön Clever: Challenge I
Description:
A new sheet layout, similar (but not identical) to "Challenge II" offered in the Ganz Schon Clever app.

This challenge changes the constraints and bonuses of each section, while keeping all the rules of the base game.

The differences from the app include:

     No extra points for marking all 12 blue cells.
     No fox in the sixth reroll circle.

Name: Doppelt so Clever: Challenge I
Description:
A new sheet layout, similar (but not identical) to "Challenge II" offered in the Doppelt so clever app.

This challenge changes the constraints and bonuses of each section, while keeping all the rules of the base game.

Name: Hedge Maze
Description:
Hedge Maze is a two player print’n’play game that can be played with a Chess board and a set of Dominoes or with the printable components.

The goal of the game is to guide your two peasants over to the other side of an ever changing maze. To do this you can both move your peasants and move the hedges of the maze, making way for your peasants or blocking your opponent.

—description from the designer

Name: Live Free or Die: Three Battles for America
Description:
Following the successful deployment of missiles on Cuba in 1962, the Communists gained much ground in Latin America. Western Europe became less convinced of American commitment to defend the continent. This led to the NATO alliance being dissolved and replaced by a neutral bloc.

America was now alone!

Live Free or Die is an alternate history simulation of battles associated with a Communist invasion of continental USA. Live Free or Die is a game set consisting of three independent games:


     Asian Invasion captures the Peoples' Asian Alliance landings in California;
     Remember the Alamo covers the Organization of Central American States drive into Texas; and
     Southern Discomfort focuses on a Warsaw Pact invasion of Florida, Georgia.


The Basic Game focuses on ground combat, providing a quick, entertaining game. The Advanced Game introduces air and naval units as well as additional specialized units like cruise missiles, laser defenses and political troops. And beware, there are rules for nuclear, biological and chemical warfare!

The three 11"x17"map boards represent battle grounds in California, Florida, Georgia and Texas. The 480 1/2" counters (die-cut and back-printed) show brigade and divisional level forces of the US, the Warsaw Pact (Soviet Union, East Germany, Poland and Czeckoslovakia), the People's Asian Alliance (China, North Korea and Viet Nam), and the Organization of Central American States (Cuba, Mexico and Nicaragua).

Name: Empire (Second Edition)
Description:
A complete rulesbook and reference source to the Napoleonic Wars 1796-1815.  Written by Scotty Bowden

Second Edition Printings

First - May 1977
Second - July 1977
Third - January 1978

Name: Mafia No.5
Description:
Mafia No. 5 is a thrilling card game for outlaws.

Keep your products in your office, while you send out your subordinates to manipulate demand on the market. If everything works out well, you will make a lot of money, but if you draw the law enforcers' attention, you will be in trouble. Outwit your rivals and rule the dark city!

—description from the publisher

Name: Forks: Mini-Expansion
Description:
Contents:
3 Ability Cards
5 Scenario Cards
1 Company Card

Adding Cards to the Base Game:
The ability cards can be added to those in the base game. The scenario cards and company card are only used when playing the scenarios of the mini-campaign.

About the Scenario:
The scenario describes events that happen over the course of five games of Forks. During the scenario, players must choose what happens, which will introduce new rules and situations to the game. The scenarios can be played multiple times with the same players, as different choices will lead the game down different paths. For your first game playing the scenario, we advise you to play without the Merge/Swap card or abilities.

Name: Raid on Taihoku: Keelung Expansion – Conflagration
Description:
This board game is dedicated to the people of Taiwan and those who care about Taiwan.

In the closing stages of World War II, when Taiwan was still a Japanese colony, more than one hundred U.S. B-24 bombers launched an air raid on Taihoku (Taipei). Political and military facilities were the main targets, but civilians were also affected. Many homes were destroyed, and a large number of people were killed or wounded.

In  Keelung Expansion - Conflagration
Players can combine expansion with original Raid on Taihoku.
With two maps assembled, there are more variety, higher difficulty and fun in the game.

In the midst of war, you must cooperate to survive. You will be fettered and will face difficult choices. We must live until the war is over. To win or to die?

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombies!: Need more Brains
Description:
You are an infected, aimless Zombie mutant and with your fellow rotting mutants you roam the apocalyptic future in search of beautiful pink Human Brains. Brains and more Brains is all that energises you and your Zombie horde's very existence but as you search the devastated and infected towns, beware the few resilient humans that are still left unaffected as they are tough, heavily armed preppers who like nothing more than to shoot you and your slow wandering mutant Zombie brothers and to stop your relentless quest and monotonous chant, “Need more Brains!”.

Light, Push your Luck, Black Jack style game for 1-4 Players.
Ages 12+ takes about 20-30 minutes and is a light Horror Theme, filler game.

Solo play is fun as you strive to become a Super Zombie, horde leader which is almost impossible.

Overall - Light filler, good for family game night and waiting for friends to arrive or to fill in some time with a bit of fun or for some quick Solo challenging play.

—description from the designer

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Builder Crossbowmen
Description:
The brotherhood of the Night’s Watch has pledged to keep Westeros safe from all the horrors that live north of The Wall. Forsaking any life they might’ve had before joining, they are entirely committed to their vows. Within their number are the Builders. They maintain the fortifications in and around The Wall, as well as all the arms and armor used by the Night’s Watch. Their forges create some of the best and hardiest gear, including the valuable crossbow. While there are the massive ballistae that act as siege weapons, as well as the Scorpions that are light enough to be taken to battle afield, they also create hand-held crossbows. They heavily train with them, becoming a fighting force of their own. Next month, Night’s Watch players will be able to add the Builder Crossbowmen to their forces. Let’s take a look at how they operate.
Being the ones that built the crossbows, the Builders are also experts in their use, having trained intensely with them. This results in the to-hit number for their crossbow attack being a 3+ and rolling seven dice when at full ranks, and even when one rank has been destroyed. The power in these “little instruments of death” is so great that they can attack at Long Range and apply Sundering. The crossbows aren’t the only armaments the Builders have. They also can go into battle wielding longswords. While they are competent in their use, the Builder Crossbowmen would still prefer to reach out and touch the enemy at range. And, if an enemy wants to do them engage via a charge, the unit’s Ready! Aim! Fire! order lets them get an extra attack in before the enemy closes in.
On the defensive side of things, the unit shows their weakness. With a Defense Save of 6+ and a Morale value of 7+, this is a unit that really does not want the enemy to attack them. Their moderate speed of 5 also means that they can’t outrun most enemy units wanting to chase them down. However, the Builder Crossbowmen would really hope that their last-ditch attack thins the enemy ranks as much as possible.
The Builder Crossbowmen are a perfect unit for Night’s Watch players who want to add some ranged attack damage to their force. They should be kept well away from the enemy, but within range of their trusty crossbows. Supported by units able to take a melee hit if necessary, they can do a lot to bring victory to the Black.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Dark Metal
Description:
A mercenary company is stranded within a star system as a cold war heats up and results in the destruction of the only wormgate in and out of the system. Not wanting to stick around and get caught up in an unprofitable war, they take a 100-year loop out into deep space and back in stasis. They awake to find no new wormgate, fractured civilizations, and broken cities. The Captain's first order of business is to find some real food to eat. And to figure out what the frak is going on.

Dark Metal: Mercenaries in the Deep is a solo or co-op, open miniatures science fiction tabletop adventure RPG. Players can create their own squad leader and allies, or select from one of the pre-made character sets to get started a little quicker. Movement is either distance or hex based and the board is created by the player based on the scenario's instructions. The gamer provides their own minis, terrain, and dice from their existing collection to create the experience.

Players go through a series of missions and scenarios linked together with progressive narrative elements on their journey to investigate what has happened within the star system since they left. They will grow in abilities, knowledge, and equipment as they are sent out on mission after mission. Player builds range from heavily armored warriors bristling with weaponry, to lithe bio engineered splicers dashing across the terrain to engage in close combat, to half metal cybernetic beings aiming high caliber weapons downrange to plink off enemies at a distance.

Dark Metal will be initially available as a print and play game with optional accessories.

—description from the publisher

Name: 小さきモノのフェーデ (Chiisaki Mono no Fehde)
Description:
In å°ã•ããƒ¢ãƒŽã®ãƒ•ã‚§ãƒ¼ãƒ‡ (Feud of the Little Ones), two players act as gods competing for a store of faith by manipulating cards on a 6x6 chess-like board.

The cards come in three varieties: Units, or characters you can place and move to fight; Objects, which are buildings or other stationary items; and Actions, which affect the board without staying on it.

Each round, players draft Units, Objects, and Actions in turn, and then play some of each. In the War phase they get enough turns to move each unit once. Victory is achieved when you destroy all your opponent's units, get over 1000 Faith, or by having the most Faith at the end of four rounds.

Playing Units and Objects is free, but when units are destroyed they give Faith to your opponent, making stronger units riskier. Actions give you an immediate advantage but cost Faith, so getting the timing of everything right is of critical importance.

—user summary

Name: JIYU The board game
Description:
Theme: Feudal Japan in a fantasy setting where the Samurai and Yakuza are in heavy conflict

Game-play: A chess based game with RPG elements to keep the gameplay fresh and everyone on their toes. 5 Hero cards each represented by tokens with their own unique movement. Buff/Debuff cards that change the way they react to situations and also the ability to construct walls to block players or lay traps.

Goal of the game: To assassinate the clan leader or eliminate all present enemy board heroes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Big Time Golf
Description:
Congratulations! You and a friend have just made it into the lofty ranks of professional golfers! You’re about to play your first tournament as pros, but the two of you decide to play a round on the golf course a few days early. It’s a fairly tough course and bragging rights are on the line, so you really want to win this “friendly” match!

Big Time Golf isn’t just “choose your club and roll the dice” like every other golf game. While it does feature club selection, it’s card-based with press-your-luck gameplay, and has an unparalleled degree of player interaction. So grab your golf bag and let’s play!

—description from the designer

Name: Räuber Raupe
Description: Räuber Raupe features a smiling, devious-looking caterpillar. Don't trust it!

Name: Hipatia
Description:
Hipatia is a majority card game, as disciples and helpers of the ancient philosopher you will help Hipatia achieving her great advances and life goals.

Also you will have to be careful with the hate of Cirilo, patriarch of Alexandria, as you are in the middle of a political struggle between him and Orestes, the imperial prefect. Draw too much attention from the patriarch followers can end in your dead (and elimination from the game).

Use the powers in the cards to bypass your rivals in becoming the best disciple of Hipatia (alive).

—description from the designer
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: President Zeus
Description:
Geopolitical problems are so much easier to solve when you can hurl lightning at them. All of the Greek Gods in this game have special powers and can deal with international situations in their own way.

Not only can you, as one of them, gain influence and create fantastic achievements, but you can use powers of other Gods too — as long as you give them influence. In the end, the one that generates enough influence to replace Zeus as president is the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: New Frontiers: The Starry Rift
Description: New Frontiers: Starry Rift adds 16 home worlds, 10 developments, 13 worlds, and 8 goals to expand the New Frontiers base game.  Xeno worlds add a risk/reward element to military conquest. 6 solo campaigns supply a new play experience.

Name: Res Arcana: Lux et Tenebrae
Description:
In a dark cathedral, a mage harnesses the power of demons to enhance her spells. In an alchemical laboratory, a diviner inscribes a scroll of destruction. Meanwhile, a bard and beastmaster seek out the prismatic dragon and golden lion to keep these forces of darkness at bay.

Res Arcana: Lux et Tenebrae adds 4 new Places of Power, 12 artifacts, 4 mages, 4 monuments, and 2 magic items to Res Arcana. It also extends the game to five players, adds scaling rules for fewer players, and introduces two new things: scrolls and demons.

Name: Warehouse 13: Leena
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Character for Warehouse 13: The Board Game.

Includes:
1 Warehouse Agent Shield
4 Small-sized Ability Cards (44 x 67 mm)
1 Character Token

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Poor Fellows
Description:
The Poor Fellows do not wear fancy armor. Their weapons are whatever was close by when they headed into combat. But enemy Commanders that discount their prowess in battle will soon find themselves overrun by fanatics.

The Poor Fellows Unit Box gives Lannister Commanders a unit full of surprises on the battlefield. Having only moderate combat abilities, their true strength comes from passing Morale tests. That gives them a Faith token that can later be spent to deal direct Wounds to enemies. The unit also continually regenerates its numbers as the battle goes on, calling up new faithful to join their ranks each time they activate. The unit can be on the verge of destruction one turn, then swell back to full combat strength in a couple turns.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk Heroes I
Description:
The Free Folk aren’t necessarily fighting to place a representative on the Iron Throne. Though, they certainly would if given the opportunity. They are just trying to fight for an equal opportunity to live life like the southerners do, with their own lands and the rights to do on them as they please. From out of this rag-tag band, heroes have arisen to take leadership roles within the various tribes.

The Free Folk Heroes I box gives Free Folk Commanders a whole host of new options for their forces. Coming up from the ranks of everyday men and women, people like Rattleshirt, Harma the Dogshead, or The Weeper, are set to move the course of the Free Folk in certain directions. This set includes both Unit Attachments as well as Non-Combat Units, including several Commanders and their accompanying Tactics cards. The fate of the Free Folk is in their hands.

—description from the publisher

Contents:
7 Miniatures

     Jarl
     The Weeper
     Styr, Magnar of Thenn
     Ygritte
     Harma's Bannerman
     Harma the Dogshead
     Rattleshirt, Lord of Bones


1 Unit Card
10 Attachment Cards
2 NCU Cards
24 Tactics Cards
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Epic Card Game: New Dawn Promo Card
Description:
Epic Card Game: New Dawn Promo Card

Good Event

Draw two cards or it ts is your turn, banish all champions, then each player may put a champion from their hand into play.

Cost: 1

Name: Epic Card Game: Necromancer Apprentice Promo Card
Description:
Epic Card Game: Necromander Apprentice Promo Card

Evil Human Champion

Blitz

Tap: Banish target card from any discard pile. If that card is a champion, put a zombie token into play.

Name: Loto Géographique
Description:
It is a Bingo type game where the Loto cards have historical cities of France view marked on them. A set of numbered wooden coins matching the cities and numbers on the cards are drawn from a bag by a Teller. A player holding a Loto card with a square having a matching citie calls it out.

Each player receives a pool of 36 counters at the start of the game. Six counters are paid into a pool for each Loto card played. A player must pay two more counters to the pool any time an improper claim is made on a Ticket. The first player to fill up six squares on any one card claims the pool.

Name: Ocean Crisis: Catastrophe
Description:
Ocean Crisis: Catastrophe is the expansion of the main game, with brand new engaging missions and scenarios, including Oil Tank Spill, Beached Whale, and Ghost Nets; at the same time, we present the futuristic Ocean Vacuum Research Project. Will the research be in time to save our future? Get ready for the challenge!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ancients Part 2: Lost In Time (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
The seeds of doubt about the real intentions of the Agency are growing inside you and the next destination is certainly not what you expected...

The trilogy is set in several times and timelines (AT and NT) and will take you on a journey where not only the background of Elois, Syaan and the third faction will be revealed eventually but also the question of your allegiance will be raised.

Name: Ganz Schön Rolf (fan expansion for Ganz Schön Clever)
Description:
This is a full fan-made expansion using the same dice colors as the original game. There is a new kind of special action - the "freeze" effect - introduced, as well as a new grey sector that is related to all colors.

—description from the designer

Name: Wehrmacht: The European Theater of WW-II
Description:
A strategic game of the European Theater of World War II. In many respects it appears to be a simplified version of John Prados' Rise and Decline of the Third Reich; it has a similar production system, in which the powers earn production points for what they control and spend them on units and other things, covers a similar array of military options, and has turns of the same length (three months). There are many smaller details which are the same, e.g. having only armor units exert a zone of control.

Five scenarios are provided. Four differ only in length - they cover from Summer 1939 to Spring 1945, Winter 1945-6, Winter 1940-1, and Winter 1941-2 - and can be played by from two to six players. The fifth scenario covers the same period as the first one but players are free to make any alliances they wish; this requires six players.

A few optional rules are provided, such as having Turkey and Spain enter as minor allies, building new production sources, partisans, etc.

Name: Table Air Combat: Walrus
Description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of aircraft represented by counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
A performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The Supermarine Walrus was a biplane with a central floating hull. Its single engine was suspended between the two sets of wings and featured a pusher-prop. This arrangement allowed a gunner position in the nose and tail.
The Walrus was catapult-launched from British warships. Upon completing its patrol, cranes would winch it back aboard the warship. 
Its intended purpose was to provide reconnaissance and gunnery spotting. However, the Walrus was heavily used for air-sea rescue and antisubmarine patrols.

This set is a self-contained rulebook with miniatures for the Walrus and three scenarios:

Fiord Encounter:  While searching for U-boats, a Walrus engages in a dogfight with a He-111 bomber.

Operation Canned:  Walrus flying boats from a Royal Navy cruiser attack an Italian coastal radio station. A single Cr.42 Falco biplane fighter defends.

Air-Sea Rescue: The Royal Air Force races the Luftwaffe to rescue a high-profile aircrew downed in the English Channel. Spitfire Mk.V escort the Walrus. A Ju-87 Stuka substitutes for a Luftwaffe Ar-196 float plane, escorted by Bf-109F.

—description from the publisher

Name: Table Air Combat: C.205 Veltro
Description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of aircraft represented by counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
A performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The C.200 design was modified to hold the Daimler-Benz 601 V-12, the same engine in Germany’s Bf-109 series. The resulting C.202 gained a performance boost, but still lacked firepower compared to Allied fighters.  
Adding 20mm cannons in the wings and an upgrade to the DB 605 engine created the C.205, a fighter able to tangle with the best of American and British fighters.

This set is a self-contained rulebook with miniatures for the C.202 Folgore, the C.205 Veltro, and two scenarios:

Operation Bowery: C.202 Folgore fighters and SM.79 Sparviero bombers attempt to stop British forces in Malta from reinforcing with new Spitfire MkVs. Hurricane I fighters assist the new Spitfires.

Rome: C.205 Veltro fighters defend a railroad marshalling yard against American B-25J Mitchell Bombers and P-38L Lightnings.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tramways: The Leisure Expansion
Description:
This is the fifth set of mini expansions for Tramways.

It contains:

     The Tower expansion: a new action allows players to build towers
     The Leisure expansion
     The Rail Worker expansion: rail workers have a new ability if you use them as passengers
     The Super Development cards: 3 new development cards with 2 icons per slot


This expansion also includes an A4 player aid with all actions available in Tramways and its expansions with associated rules reminders.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kick Punch
Description:
Kick Punch is a wrestling inspired card/board game for 2-4 players and takes 45 minutes to play.  Easy to play but takes skill and luck to master.  Kick and Punch your way through your opponents using your unique wrestler and their skills to become the king of the ring!  Fight your friends, destroy your enemies in Kick Punch!

Players play cards at the same time to attack and defend against the other wrestlers in the ring.  Knock out your opponents to get the top spot in the ring and gain power to be able to activate your wrestlers unique skills.  The first player to reach 20 power wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Battle of Tippecanoe
Description:
The year is 1811. Tecumseh, a Shawnee leader from the Ohio country, and his brother, the prophet Tenskwatawa, have drawn together an intertribal coalition of Native Americans, with the village of Tippecanoe in the northwest Indiana Territory as its primary power center. This confederation of Shawnee, Lenape, Sauk, Miami, Pottawatomie, and other Native Americans, joined together for mutual aid and defense, is deemed a threat by the US Government, who decide it must be put down before it grows strong enough to resist white settlement of the Northwest Territory. Goals: The Native player must first gather and arm a coalition of warriors, and then lead a defense of the Tecumseh Confederacy’s capital at Tippecanoe. If the Native player succeeds, the US may be forced to come to peaceful terms with the Tecumseh Confederacy and treat it as a legitimate political entity to be reckoned with. The US player must march and deploy a force strong enough to overcome Native defenses at Tippecanoe. If the US player succeeds, the Confederacy will be scattered and the Northwest Territory will eventually be settled by whites.

The game takes place in two stages: preparation and battle. The preparation stage is distinct for each player, but both preparation stages involve creating the deck that will be used to play the battle stage against the other player.

The game is a history-based deck-building card game. The main thing that makes it distinct from most such games is that the deck is built in-game by each player, and the two players each have a different method of building a deck.

—description from the designer

Name: Gravity Falls Sugoroku
Description: This is a simple Japanese board game called “SUGOROKU”, which is similar to Candyland, in that players move their piece from start to finish, collecting cards as they go. The goal of the game is to collect Journals 1, 2, and 3 while reliving key events from the television series before reaching the end-of-summer 13th birthday party for Mabel and Dipper.

Name: Poten
Description:
Poten is an educational and functional board game that will help you find your potential and even think about a new job.

Poten is a standalone expansion of Flip. While Flip help you to learn about your personalities, Poten help you to find jobs that suit your personalities. When you combine those two games together and play them, they will give you a great fun and clear view of your passion.

How To Play:

     Draft six 'work cards'.
     Set five 'icon cards' on the table.
     One player becomes a narrator and the rest will play the guessers. 
     The narrator selects two icon cards and place a job card next to each icon card.
     And talk about two jobs represented by each set of icon & work cards as if he or she is currently working in that field. 
     The other players listen to the stories and vote a job that suits the narrator better with the O token and place the X token on the other job secretly. 


The objective of the game is to achieve the most victory points by guessing the right jobs that go along well with other players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Invasión celta
Description:
Invasión celta is about the Celtic invasions of ancient Greece. It is a card game with option to play with 4 players, but perfect with 2. It is played in about 25 minutes and its rules try to be simple.

In this game you have two card types, units for reduce the moral of your opponent and events for change the normal rules (inspired in historical events). The first player without moral, loose the game. Celts also need to win before the deck is finished.

—description from the designer

Invasión celta trata sobre las poco conocidas invasiones celtas de la antigua Grecia. Es un juego de cartas con opción a 4 jugadores, pero pefecto para 2. Se juega en unos 25 minutos y sus reglas intentan ser sencillas.
