En este juego tienes dos tipos de cartas, unidades para reducir la moral de tu oponente y eventos para cambiar las reglas normales (inspirados en eventos históricos). El primer jugador sin moral, pierde el juego. Los celtas también necesitan ganar antes de que se termine el mazo.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Arcadia Tenebra
Description:
Arcadia Tenebra is a heavily story-driven mystery adventure RPG board game in which you assume the role of the investigator on the quest of stopping a serial killer before The Blood Moon rises.

The story is set in the late 19th century, in a fictional province of Arcadia Tenebra.  A part of The Hungarian-Austrian Empire, Arcadia Tenebra is located somewhere in a south-eastern Europe, today commonly known as Balkan Peninsula. The setting is not exactly historically accurate: it is partially inspired by history and then fictionally upgraded, with a twist of absurd and dark humor on the trail of Monty Python and The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy. That’s why players will meet Nikola Tesla or T-1800, half-man half-steam machine (or vice versa?), who roams Arcadian forests in search for some chick named Marah Pommor that no one never heard of.

Become one of six antihero investigators with their respectively unique special abilities and explore Arcadia Tenebra following the Leads and collecting the Clues, as each of those will bring you one step closer to busting the mad killer. As the story unfolds, soon enough you'll find out that in Arcadia Tenebra everybody's hiding something and nobody likes you. Moreover, you’ll have to face wild animals, marauders, imperial agents and even mythical creatures – as your investigation will eventually carry you beyond the veils of the rational world.

Embark on this adventurous journey and meet some unforgettable NPCs. Intimidate, Outsmart or Charm them to obtain the Clues and their piece of the story.  Or do them a Favour in exchange for the Clues. Solve riddles, crack safes, fight your way through or use your wits and charm to progress. Decide whether you will get involved in local politics or even stand in the way of great empires. Or choose to keep your knees low and let politics unfold without your interference. Unlock new possibilities to boost your PC's abilities as you explore new locations in Arcadia Tenebra.

Build your character by facing the consequences of your action (Luckies & Unluckies Cards) and prepare for the final showdown. If things get too hard, team up with other players and solve the case together before the time runs out! And never forget to roleplay, because every time you successfully roleplay your character, you get a significant bonus on a roll check.

Arcadia Tenebra has its roots in old CRPGs such as Fallout, Baldur's Gate and Planescape: Torment.

—description from the designer

Name: Sushi War: Laser Battle
Description:
In the near future, an Alien Race formed by Sushi is conquering the entire world.
But when everything seemed to be lost, 4 Legendary Chef Warriors came from the future to avoid the World destruction.
Each Chef Warrior wants to prove his worth and they will compete between each other to be the first to safe the World.
Be ready for the various challenges in the game and use Laser Chopsticks as a tremendous force to reach your purposes.

An incredible battle with chopsticks, sushi dice and a bit of intriguing tech! Easy to learn and to explain, Sushi War: Laser Battle is more than a simple dexterity game! Discover an innovative way to play! Use your chopsticks to build real Sushi Towers and defeat your opponents throwing down their compositions!

Join an unique Arena using Laser Chopsticks of different colors: only with them you can destroy the Sushi menace!

Main features of the game:


     Build Sushi Towers with the correct dice sides up as fast as you can to earn points.
     Throw dice against your opponents to destroy their towers and win easier.
     Change game modes with exclusive challenges and prove your talent with chopsticks.
     Switch on the Laser Chopsticks and eliminate the Sushi race from the Arena!


—description from the publisher

Name: A Pleasant Journey to Neko: Penguin Habitat 3
Description: Penguin Habitat 3: Once per round during the Action Phase, discard an interference tile and take one discarded dice from the main board.

Name: Bedroom Battle: Naughty Winter Nights
Description:
Bedroom Battle is a game for couples where you play against each other to win rewards in the form of sexy favors.

The concept is very simple. Each game round you use battle cards to compete for a reward card containing three different sexy challenges. The winner of the round then gets to select one of the sexy challenges for you both to act out. Once you have completed the challenge you move on to the next round and start playing for a new reward card. To make things interesting the rewards will become more and more naughty until the game ends with the final reward - which of course is the naughtiest of them all.

Naughty Winter Nights contains 21 Christmas-themed battle cards and 54 challenges that are either romantic or extra kinky.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bedroom Battle: Hot Summer Days
Description:
Bedroom Battle is a game for couples where you play against each other to win rewards in the form of sexy favors.

The concept is very simple. Each game round you use battle cards to compete for a reward card containing three different sexy challenges. The winner of the round then gets to select one of the sexy challenges for you both to act out. Once you have completed the challenge you move on to the next round and start playing for a new reward card. To make things interesting the rewards will become more and more naughty until the game ends with the final reward - which of course is the naughtiest of them all.

The Hot Summer Days expansion includes 21 new summer-themed Battle Cards and 54 fun and playful challenges on 18 Reward Cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Western Tropic
Description:
In the not-too-distant future, the game of Texas Hold’em poker has evolved. This enhanced format of the game, named after the secret location of the largest annual tournament, is known as Western Tropic. Each year, the world’s most elite players gather on a tropical island somewhere in the Pacific. The eccentric billionaire who organizes this tournament has quite a fondness for the “Old West” and has gone to great lengths to transform the center of the island into an authentic western town, and he encourages participants to dress accordingly...

As one of the players invited to compete in Western Tropic, your goal is to be the first player to reach 60 points and claim victory, fortune, and fame.

Western Tropic uses a 5x5 grid that acts as a communal, but ever-changing set of cards that players use to create the best possible poker hand. Much like Texas Hold'em, each player has hole cards that are unique to them. But, the game uses an extra (third) hole card each round that can be traded in, to grant various actions such as moving your character around the grid, or changing the grid, altogether.

Each suit gives you different abilities, and those can be used in unique ways to either improve your hand or obstruct others. There are also 8 jokers that can provide additional chaos.

Western Tropic takes the language of poker, and combines it with popular game mechanisms like deck-building and area control.

—description from the designer

Name: A Pleasant Journey to Neko: Penguin Habitat 4
Description: Penguin Habitat 4: Immediately get a Dice Reward (choose any). Once per round, you can get two times dice rewards. You can choose different reward.

Name: All About Town: Kennebec Valley, ME
Description:
This is a Chamber of Commerce promotional game in the manner of Park & Shop. Players try to complete their shopping list and return home first.

The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard map of Kennebec Valley, ME from a residence square to the bank and shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on his shopping list wins the game!

Name: Finding Fluffy
Description:
Finding Fluffy is a tile based, competitive, path laying game where two to four players race to find their lost pets.

The game comes with two sets of rules, Basic which can be played by children as young as five. In this version the players are just placing tiles and trying to find their pet in the most efficient way, this teaches the kids logic solving and basic mathematics.

The second set of rules, Advance, is aimed at kids who understand how the basic game works and want more of a challenge and also adults looking for a short strategy game. In this version tiles placed by individual players count towards end game scoring in different ways.

The game plays in around thirty minutes and is beautifully illustrated by Mary Cousins.

—description from the designer
